title: Regional Development Education Design Utilizing Geographical Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of fundamental geography concepts at the high school level
context.additional_context: A blended course combining online (concept learning) and face-to-face (workshops/discussions) activities, featuring project-based learning for regional development based on Japanese high school case studies

learning_goals: One can explain factors shaping regional identity using at least three geographical concepts (e.g., regional plasticity, resilience, scale)
One can analyze trade-offs between regional issues and propose solutions through a geographical framework
One can visually represent future development scenarios using a worksheet that evaluates regional change processes
One can write a regional characteristics analysis report reflecting learner-community interactions

resources: Japanese High School Regional Development Case Database
Virtual Interview Video Materials with Local Community Stakeholders

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
